citation.article-title: Taxonomy of Australian clinical isolates of the genus Photorhabdus and proposal of Photorhabdus asymbiotica subsp. asymbiotica subsp. nov. and P. asymbiotica subsp. australis subsp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Photorhabdus asymbiotica subsp. asymbiotica subsp. nov.
Photorhabdus asymbiotica subsp. asymbiotica (a.sym.bi.o′ti.ca. Gr. pref a not; N.L. fem. adj. symbiotica living together; N.L. fem. adj. asymbiotica not symbiotic).
Maximum temperature for growth in nutrient broth is 37–38 °C.
Positive for urease and aesculin hydrolysis; weakly positive for Simmons' citrate.
Acid is produced from trehalose and usually from aesculin; variable for gluconate.
Annular haemolysis occurs on sheep blood and horse blood agars.
Positive for Tween 60 and Tween 80 esterases; Tween 40 esterase activity is variable.
Natural habitat is uncertain; all isolates were obtained from human clinical specimens in the USA.
The GenBank accession numbers of the 16S rRNA and gyrB gene sequences of the type strain are Z76755 (Szállás et al., 1997) and AY278494, respectively.
